episode_title: 304 - The One with the Metaphorical Tunnel

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s: everyone is there and they are watching an info-mercial that stars Joey.

content.speaker: Host
content.text: Welcome everybody, welcome to Amazing Discoveries!
Phoebe: Oh, oh! It’s on again!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You guys, can we please not watch this all right.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Shhhh!

content.speaker: Host
content.text: Folks, has this ever happened to you. You go to the refrigerator to get a nice glass of milk, (Joey is in the background struggling to open a cartoon of milk) and these darn cartons are so flingin’-flangin’ hard to open.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, you said it Mike. (rips open the carton and spills milk on the counter) Aw! There’s got to be a better way!

content.speaker: Mike
content.text: And there is Kevin.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Can we please turn this off?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Noo way, Kevin.

content.speaker: Mike
content.text: There is a revolutionary new product that guarantees that you’ll never have to open up milk cartons again. Meet the Milk Master 2000.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you intrigued?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re flingin’-flangin’ right I am!

content.speaker: Mike
content.text: Keep in mind, he’s never used this product before, you’re gonna see how easy this is to do. (to Kevin) Go ahead. (’Kevin’ starts using the product, it is a spout that you jab into a paper milk carton so that you don’t have to rip it open.) This works with any milk carton.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow, it is easy. (starts to poor the milk) Now, I can have milk everyday.
content.parenthetical: on TV, finishing installing the Milk Master 2000

content.text: (they all start laughing at him)

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler, Monica, Janice are sitting on the couch, and Phoebe is sitting next to them in the chair.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, it’s official there are no good movies.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Well, let’s go to a bad one and make out. (they start to kiss and lean back into Monica.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Perhaps, you would like me to turn like this, (turns sideways on the couch) so that you can bunny bump against my back.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, man. What’s up?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Maybe you can tell me. My agent would like to know why I didn’t show up at the audition I didn’t know I had today. The first good thing she gets me in weeks. How could you not give me the message?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I’ll tell ya I do enjoy guilt, but, ah, it wasn’t me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes, it was! It was him! Uh huh! (they all stare at her) Okay, it was me!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How is it you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, it was just, it was all so crazy, you know. I mean, Chandler was in the closet, counting to 10, and he was up to 7 and I hadn’t found a place to hide yet. I-I-I meant to tell you, and I wrote it all down on my hand. See, all of it. (shows him her hand)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yep, that’s my audition.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: See, now this is why I keep notepads everywhere.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yep, and that’s why we don’t invite you to play.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: What is the great tragedy here? You go get yourself another appointment.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, Estelle tried, you know. The casting director told her that I missed my chance.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That is unfair. I’ll call her and tell her it was totally my fault.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pheebs, you can’t do that. The casting director doesn’t talk to friends, she only talks to agents.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What a sad little life she must lead. Okay, ooh (starts dialing).

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What, what are you doing? What are you doing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, no, no, I know, I know, ooh. (on the phone in a different voice) ‘Hi, this is Katelynn, from Phoebe Buffay’s office. Um, is um, Ann there for Phoebe, she’ll know what it’s about.’

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hang up, hang up. (reaches with his good arm, but Phoebe grabs it and he tries to reach the phone with his other arm but can’t because of the sling.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: ‘Annie! Hi. Listen we got a problem with Joey Tribbiani, apparently he missed his audition. Who did you speak to in my office? Estelle, no, I don’t know what I’m going to do with her. No. All right, so your husband leaves and burns down the apartment, the world does not stop.’

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Is anybody else scared?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: ‘Right, well look, um, if Joey loses this audition, that is it for Estelle. I don’t care! Annie you are a doll, what time can you see him?’ (to Monica) I need a pen. (Chandler hands her one, but she needs something to right on, so she tilts Chandler’s head over and writes on the back of his neck)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Get the woman a pad! Get the woman a pad! A pad! A pad!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, now you want a pad.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Carol and Susan are dropping off Ben

content.speaker: Carol and Susan
content.text: Hey!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: There’s my boy! Here’s my boy! And here’s his Barbi (Ben is holding a Barbi doll) What’s ah, what’s my boy doing with a Barbi?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: He picked it out of the toy store himself, he loves it.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: He carries it everywhere, it’s like a security blanket, but with ski boots and a kicky beret.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, it’s, it’s, it’s cute. Why, why, why does he have it, again?

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: So he’s got a doll? So what? Unless you’re afraid he’s gonna grow up and be in show business.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: This doesn’t have anything to do with the fact that he is being raised by two women, does it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You know what it’s fine. If you’re okay with the Barbi thing, so am I.
(cut to later in the day)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Give daddy the Barbi! Ben, give, give me the Barbi. Okay, how ‘bout, don’t you want to play with the monster truck? (makes a monster truck sound) No. Okay, oh, oh, how about a Dino-soilder? (squawks like a dinosaur)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, you are so pathetic. Why can’t your son just play with his doll? (uses the Milk Master 2000 to pour milk into her cereal)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I gotta go to work. Has anybody seen my left boob?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I love that movie. (Joey is using it as a pillow)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: There it is. Joey, what are you doing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m sorry, it just felt nice.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joe. Joe! Answer the phone.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, I only got one good arm, you know. You should be doing stuff for me. Go get me a sweater.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Just do it! Okay, it’s Janice and if I get it I’m going to have to see her tonight. (phone stops ringing) Oh, that’s great I’m gonna have to see her tonight.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s the big deal? Why don’t you wanna see Janice?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, last night at dinner, when the meals came, she put half her chicken piccata on my plate and took my tomatoes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And that’s bad because…, you hate chicken piccata?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Noo.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You didn’t want to share your tomatoes, tomatoes are very important to you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, it’s like all of the sudden, we were this couple. And this alarm started going off in my head: ‘Run for your life! Get out of the building!’

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Men are unbelievable.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What is it with you people! I mean, the minute you start to feel something, you have to run away?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know, that, (looks at her fake chest, and loses his train of thought, temporarily) that’s why I don’t want to go tonight, I’m afraid I’m going to say something stupid.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, you mean like that guy thing where you act mean and distant until you get us to break up with you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, you know about that?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look what do I do? I wanna get past this, I don’t wanna be afraid of the commitment thing. I wanna go through the tunnel, to the other side!
(Joey looks quizzically at Ross)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Where there is no fear of commitment.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do we have any…(turns around and bumps Monica’s fake chest) Do we have any thoughts here?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I’ve never been through the tunnel myself, ’cause as I understand it, you’re not allowed to go through with more than one girl in the car, right. But, it seems to me it’s pretty much like anything else, you know, face your fear. It have a fear of heights, you go to the top of the building! If you’re afraid of bugs…get a bug. Right. In this case, you have a fear of commitment, so I say you go in there and be the most committed guy there ever was.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Amazingly, that makes sense.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You think?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, yeah. Go for it man, jump off the high dive, stare down the barrel of the gun, pee into the wind!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, Joe, I assure you if I’m staring down the barrel of a gun, I’m pretty much peeing every which way.

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe’s beeper is going off

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, it’s your audition from this morning. Can I use the phone again?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sure Pheebs, you know, that’s what it’s there for, emergencies and pretend agents.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on baby, come on!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: ‘Hi, I have Phoebe Buffay returning a page. Okay, well, um, she’s in her car I’ll have to patch you through.’

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Very nice touch.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: ‘Okay, go ahead.’ (in normal voice on phone) Um, hi Annie. (listens) Fantastic! (to Joey) You got it. (on phone) Oh, okay, um, ‘Will he work for scale?’ you ask me. Well, I don’t know about that, (Joey clears his throat to signify yes) except that I do and he will. Great, oh you are such a sweetheart. I would love to have lunch with you, how about we have lunch next…(hangs up phone) Op, went through a tunnel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Unbelievable.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thank you so much.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It was really fun, I mean I’ve never talked on a car phone before.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You were amazing, could you just do me this huge favor, you see there’s this one other audition that I really, really want, and Estelle couldn’t get me in.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I don’t know. I mean it was fun one time.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on, please, it’ll be just this one more, well actually it’s two.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Two?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! Well, well really it’s three. Please. You’re so good at it. I love you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I’ll do it, but just these three, right

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nooo, four.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler and Janice are having dinner

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: So, how come you wanted to eat in tonight?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: ’Cause, I wanted to uh, give you this. (hands her a present)

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Ohhh, are you a puppy! (opens it) Contact paper! I never really know what to say when someone you’re sleeping with gives you contact paper.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, wait there’s, there’s more. See the contact paper is to go into your brand new drawer. (gives her a drawer) See, the drawer actually goes in my dresser.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh, you didn’t have to do this.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, I did. Yes, I did. Because, you’re my girlfriend, and that’s what girlfriends should, should get.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Well, I gotta buy a vowel. Because, oh my Gawd! Who, would’ve thought that someday, Chandler Bing would buy me a drawer.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, not me. But that’s what’s happened, and, ah, and, and there’s more. We should take a trip.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: We should?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yep, we’re a couple and that’s what couples do. And, I wanna meet your parents. We should take a trip with your parents!

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: I don’t think we need to, because you’re tripping me out right now! Are you okay?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I am, I actually am. I mean this is amazing. My entire life I have feared this place, and now that I’m here it’s like what was the big deal. I could probably say ‘Let’s move in together.’ and I’d be okay.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: You probably want us to move in together?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It doesn’t scare me!

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Yeah, well, it scares me! I mean I not even divorced yet, Chandler. You know, you just invited me over here for pasta, and all of the sudden you’re talking about moving in together. And, and I wasn’t even that hungry. You know what, it’s getting a little late, and I-I should just, um…(starts to leave)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, no, no, no, don’t go! I’ve scared ya’! I’ve said too much! I’m hopeless, and awkward, and desperate for love!! (Janice leaves, Chandler then calls Janice to leave a message on her machine) Hey, Janice! It’s me. Um, yeah, I-I-I just wanna apologize in advance for having chased you down the street. (runs out the door)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica and Rachel are comforting Chandler

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, this will help. (hands him a tub of ice cream)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, I finally catch up to her and she says this relationship is going to fast and we have to slow down.

content.speaker: Rachel and Monica
content.text: Uff.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That is never good.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Then I got all needy and clingy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, wait a minute, wait a minute, wait a minute. Maybe it’s not so bad. How did you leave it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She said she’d call me.

content.speaker: Rachel and Monica
content.text: Ohh! (both grab there stomachs in pain)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh God.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Welcome to our side of the tunnel.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This ice cream tastes like crap by the way.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, well that’s that lo-cal, non dairy, soy milk junk. We sort of, we save the real stuff for those really terminal cases.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know, when you start get screwed over all the time, you gotta switch to low-fat.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, you do.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, you don’t think I’m terminal?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, no, not at all, you’re not terminal, you just, you just need some damage control.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, okay. So, should I call her?

content.speaker: Rachel and Monica
content.text: Nooo!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: This is a very critical time right now. If you feel yourself reaching for that phone, then you go shoe shopping, you get your butt in a bubble bath. You want her back you have to start acting aloof.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: She has to know that your not ready.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right. So, what you have to do is, you have to accidentally run into her on purpose. And then act aloof.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So I’m not, not gonna lose her?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oooh, honey, you’re not a total loser.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I said, ’so I’m not gonna lose her?’

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross is still trying to get Ben to play with something other than the Barbi doll.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Guess who’s here. It’s the toughest guy in toy land, Ben. (singing) ‘A real American hero. I’m G.I. Joe!’ Drop the Barbi, drop the Barbi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: G.I. Joe? Do you really think he’s gonna fall for that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: G. I. Joe! Cool! Can I play?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look Ben, it’s a toy that protects U.S. oil interests overseas!

content.speaker: Joey and Ross
content.text: Go Joe!!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Helloo! Oh! (sees Joey and starts to leave)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pheebs! There you are!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No it’s not, sorry.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But Phoebe, wait! Wait! Phoebe. Phoebe! (catches her in the hallway)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, Joey! Oh, okay, see I didn’t recognize you wearing, in those…pants.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look listen, that TV movie I went in for? Did you hear anything? I think I got a shot at it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes! They called and you didn’t get it! Okay, I mean you didn’t get it, I’m sorry, I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s okay, these things happen.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But they shouldn’t happen, you know what, you’re, you’re in a terrible, terrible business. Oh God, I don’t wanna be the person who makes your face look like that.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m, I’m okay. See. (tries to smile, but fails horribly)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, now you’re sad and creepy, oh. You know what, I, I’m sorry I quit, okay, I just quit.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! No, no you can’t quit! You’re the best agent I ever had! Look Pheebs, rejection is part being an actor, you can’t take it personally.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Not personal, really, well they said that they never met an Italian actor with a worse Italian accent.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: They actually said that?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. Ooh God, there’s that face again! See I can’t do this job! I…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, no, no, see that’s why you have to do this job, agents always lie. You know, Estelle just says stuff like ‘They went another way’, but this, I can use this. (in a very bad Italian accent) I canna work on a new accent.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah okay, no if it helps you okay. Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’ll never get me, Joe!!! (he then pretends that he gets shot repeatedly and falls back against Joey and Chandler’s door, dead.)
content.parenthetical: running into the hall, in slow motion

content.description: A grocery store that Janice shops in. Chandler is on purpose, accidentally bumping into her.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: No, thank you. (Chandler makes a sound and she notices him) Chandler!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hello, Janice.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: What are you doing here?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, just a bit of shopping. How’ve you been?

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Are you being British?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No. Not anymore.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Why are you shopping here? You don’t live in this neighborhood. Were you here waiting for me?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, huh. I’m just uh, you know I’m just picking up some things for a party. (grabs a bag off of the shelf)

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Barley? What kind of party serves barley?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I’m sorry if my friends aren’t as sophisticated as yours.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Where is this party?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Here in Chelsea.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Who’s party is it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: A woman’s

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: What woman?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Chelsea.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Okay, you know, one of two things is happening here. Either you’re seeing somebody behind my back, which would make you the biggest jerk on the planet. Or, else you’re pretending that you’re seeing somebody, which just makes you so pathetic that I could start crying right here in the cereal aisle. So like which of these two guys do you want to be? (another guy walks by)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Can I be that guy?

content.description: Central Perk, Joey and Phoebe are there

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, so we got some more good rejections, lots of stuff to work on.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, shoot.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, um, oh, the zoo commercial.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I didn’t get it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No. They said you ‘Weren’t believable as a human being.’ So, you can work on that.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, what else?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, the off-Broadway play people said ‘You were pretty but dumb’.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no wait, I’m sorry, that’s ‘pretty dumb.’

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, it’s okay, no, no, no, really, look um, I really appreciate this Pheebs, but I think I’m gonna have to go back to Estelle.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, well don’t get me wrong, you’re a better agent than she is, but at least with her I don’t want to blow my pretty dumb brains out.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, no, I understand.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You do, thanks.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. Sorry. (she starts to leave)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wait a minute.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wait a minute, did you just make up all that stuff just to get out of being my agent.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, you caught me. I am so busted.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s-ah what I suspected-ah.
content.parenthetical: in a really, really bad Italian accent

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is laying on the counter and Rachel and Monica are comforting him again.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: …And then I just, you know, threw the bag of barley at her, and ran out of the store.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: My God! Chandler, we said be ‘aloof’ not ‘a doof’.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’ve actually ruined this haven’t I? It’s time for the good ice cream now, right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, it is.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know what, everything’s gonna be okay.
(phone rings)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hello. Hi, Janice! Can you hold on for a second? Okay. (to Monica and Rachel) Okay, what do I do?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Shhh…I don’t know what to do, this is totally unprecedented.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: If-if-if we ever did what you did a man would never call.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hello!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh wait, you know what, I got it, I got it, pretend like you just woke up, okay, that will throw her off. Be sleepy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, and grumpy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you, stop naming dwarves! (on phone) Hello, Janice. Hi, I’m so glad that you called, I know I’ve been acting a really weird lately. And, it’s just because I’m crazy about you, and I just got…stupid, and, and scared, and…stupid a couple of more times. I’m sorry. (listens) Really?! (listens) Really?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: He’s soo lucky, if Janice were a guy, she’d be sleeping with somebody else by now.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I love you too.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Aw, it’s soo unfair. (they both start digging into the ‘good’ ice cream)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Carol and Susan are picking up Ben, while Monica is pouring chocolate syrup, lots of it, into her ice cream.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: G. I. Joe. G. I. Joe?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, I don’t know what to tell you guys that’s the doll he chose.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: What’d you do, dip it in sugar?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, G. I. Joe’s in, Barbi’s out. And if you guys can’t deal with it, that’s your ‘too bad.’

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you being such a weenie for? So he has a Barbi, big deal. You used to dress up like a woman.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, you used to dress up in Mom’s clothes all the time.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What are you talking about?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The big hat, the pearls, the little pick handbag.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, you are totally making this up.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How can you not remember? You made us call you…Bea.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh God.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: I’ve literally never been this happy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wasn’t there a little song?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Oh please God, let there be a song.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: There was no song. (to Monica) There was no song!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: ‘I am Bea.’

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: ‘I drink tea.’

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, that’s, that’s enough. (retreats to the bathroom)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: ‘…Won’t you, won’t you, won’t you… ‘

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Won’t you dance around with me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: A-ha!!! (they all start laughing, as Ross hides in the bathroom)

content.description: It’s an old home movie of the Geller’s backyard, young Ross is dressed up as Bea, and pouring himself/herself some tea.

content.speaker: Young Ross
content.text: ‘I am Bea. I drink tea. Won’t you dance around with…’ (spills some tea and it drips onto his/her dress) Ohhh! (runs away crying)

content.speaker: Young Monica
content.text: Ross!!! (starts to wipe up the spill)
